title: English (1901) Scofield Reference Bible (Study)
description:
The Scofield Reference Bible, meticulously edited and annotated by Cyrus I. Scofield, is a pivotal work in the realm of study Bibles, markedly influencing Christian theology in the early 20th century with its promotion of dispensationalism. This theological perspective interprets the Bible as segmented into distinct eras or 'dispensations' in God's approach to humanity, a concept that found widespread acceptance through this publication

The Bible, published by Oxford University Press and incorporating the full text of the traditional Protestant King James Version, debuted in 1909. It stood out not just as a collection of Biblical texts, but as an extensive tool for in-depth scriptural study. It includes detailed annotations, explanatory notes, cross-references, and introductions, offering readers an organized and profound understanding of Biblical passages

Scofield's work underwent a revision in 1917, incorporating additional insights and clarifications. Beyond its significant role in propagating dispensationalism, the Scofield Reference Bible also set a precedent for study Bibles as instruments for scholarly research and personal devotion. Its systematic approach to scripture, with carefully chosen annotations and references, catered to both lay readers and scholars, facilitating the interpretation and comprehension of complex Biblical narratives and themes. Remaining a crucial contribution to Biblical literature, the Scofield Reference Bible continues to be an invaluable asset for students of the Bible worldwide.
